questions.title: Question 1: What is the primary function of a mobile robot's chassis?
options: b. To provide structure and support for all components
c. To control the robot's movements
questions.explanation: The chassis provides structure and support for all the components of a mobile robot.

questions.title: Question 2: Which component is considered the brain of a mobile robot?
questions.explanation: The microcontroller processes sensor data and controls the robot's movements, making it the brain of the robot.

questions.title: Question 3: What is the primary role of sensors in a mobile robot?
options: a. Provide power to the robot
c. Detect and measure environmental conditions
questions.explanation: Sensors detect and measure various environmental conditions, providing essential data for the robot's operation.

questions.title: Question 4: What is inverse kinematics used for in a robotic arm?
options: a. Calculating the position of the end effector
b. Determining the joint angles needed to place the end effector at a specific position
c. Measuring the force applied by the robot
d. Controlling the speed of the motors
questions.explanation: Inverse kinematics is used to determine the joint angles required to move the end effector to a specified position.

questions.title: Question 5: What is the purpose of a gripper on a robotic arm?
options: b. To provide power to the robot
c. To grasp and manipulate objects
d. To control the robot's movements
questions.explanation: A gripper is an end effector used by a robotic arm to grasp and manipulate objects.

questions.title: Question 6: Which type of motor is commonly used for precise control of robotic joints?
questions.explanation: Servo motors are commonly used for precise control of robotic joints.

questions.title: Question 7: What is the main function of a vision system in robotics?
options: a. To provide power to the robot
b. To process visual data and enable the robot to perceive its environment
c. To control the robot's movements
d. To sense touch and force
questions.explanation: A vision system processes visual data and enables the robot to perceive its environment.

questions.title: Question 8: Which library is commonly used for image processing in vision systems?
questions.explanation: OpenCV is a popular library for image processing and computer vision applications.

questions.title: Question 9: What is the purpose of object detection algorithms in vision systems?
options: b. To detect and identify objects in images or video frames
c. To provide power to the robot
d. To sense touch and force
questions.explanation: Object detection algorithms are used to detect and identify objects in images or video frames.

questions.title: Question 10: What does AI integration in robotics enable?
options: b. Human intervention for all tasks
questions.explanation: Integrating AI with robotics enables autonomous behavior and decision-making in robots.

questions.title: Question 11: What is reinforcement learning used for in robotics?
options: a. To provide power to the robot
b. To train robots to make decisions by rewarding desired behaviors
c. To sense touch and force
d. To control the speed of the motors
questions.explanation: Reinforcement learning involves training robots to make decisions by rewarding desired behaviors.

questions.title: Question 12: Which AI technique is crucial for natural language interaction with robots?
questions.explanation: Natural language processing (NLP) enables robots to understand and generate human language, facilitating human-robot interaction.
